content.description: Just to the right of 420. Starts on the right up the two bolts to the shelf. Crux in the middle of the climb.
content.protection: Bolts with musseys.  Shares the anchor with "High Class Dive Bar".
content.location: Move up trail to Chalkporium. When you get to the wall look right for the two bolts that take you up to the ledge.  The two routes on the right share the same start, at least for right now.  You can belay all three climbs from the ledge.

content.description: Easier terrain below leads to a roof. Traverse perfect holds that split the roof's middle, then conquer a short mantle. Ignore the exposure as you work through sparsely featured slab into a tricky sequence that unlocks glory crimps before jugs.
content.protection: 9 bolts + anchor. Anchor has rap rings.
content.location: On a ledge to the left of Chalkporium. 10 feet of easy 4th class leads to the start.

content.description: Starts left of DASR.  Climb the roof crux and then up the slabby face to an anchor with musseys.  The lower bit only has two bolts but the climbing is easy 5.2.  Look for the first bolt about 10' off the ground.  Climb gently on what appears to be loose rock near the roof.
content.protection: Eight or nine bolts with musseys, my memory sucks. First bolt is kind of hidden from the ground so step up and look around.

content.description: Not consistent but fun anyway.  Crux is at the fifth bolt, going over bulge.  Rest of climb is 5.9.  Some cleaning still needed.
content.protection: Bolts and shared mussey's with "Where's the John".
content.location: Route is the farthest right climb on the the wall.  Shares the start and top anchor with Where's the John.  You can belay all three climbs from the ledge.

content.description: Be sure you use a 70m rope. Blocky to great stemming corner to easy slab finish. Stay off this route if you are a clean freak. Get on this route if you enjoy fun climbing. Once you get to the top of the dihedral you can go left to the anchors of Litter Box if you only have a 60m rope or if you don't want to do the easy top of this climb.
content.location: (This Route is so new it's not in the new North Tahoe Guide Book) Just right of "The litter box". Goes up a blocky area and into the left facing dihedral above. To locate the route, look for the left facing dihedral above the blocky area.

content.description:
Climb goes directly over overhang. It's thin in the middle and the crux is the top out.  Take a long draw for the 4th bolt.

Since we added the long chains the route is now 5.9 unless you do the last move to the anchor.
content.location: Take trail to Dollar Store, where the trail goes right to Dollar Store, keep going straight. 420 Club starts at the end of the trail.  You can belay all three climbs from the ledge if you want.
